data.title: Mariners Announce 2022 Major League Coaching Staff
data.meta_description: SEATTLE, Wash. — Seattle Mariners President of Baseball Operations Jerry Dipoto and Mariners Manager Scott Servais announced today the Major League coaching staff for the 2022 season. In addition…
data.text:
SEATTLE, Wash. — Seattle Mariners President of Baseball Operations Jerry Dipoto and Mariners Manager Scott Servais announced today the Major League coaching staff for the 2022 season.

The Mariners 2022 staff includes four changes from 2021:

Jarret DeHart, promoted to Hitting Coach & Director of Hitting Strategy.

Tony Arnerich, named Hitting Coach.

Andy McKay, named Major League Coach and Sr. Director of Baseball Development.

Kristopher Negrón, named First Base Coach.

In addition, Manny Acta (Third Base Coach), Trent Blank (Bullpen Coach, Director of Pitching Strategy), Perry Hill (Infield Coach), Carson Vitale (Major League Field Coordinator) and Pete Woodworth (Pitching Coach) will all return to the Mariners Major League staff in 2022.

Tim Laker (Hitting Coach) declined the Mariners offer to return in 2022. Jared Sandberg (Bench Coach) will not return in 2022.

“Our mantra here is “Doesn’t Matter, Get Better” and our coaches embodied that in 2021. Each and every day they assisted in helping our players improve and that hard work showed up on the field,” Servais said. “Between the returning staff and the coaches we’ve been able to add from our player development group, every person on this staff has had a hand in helping our players succeed in their careers, and I’m looking forward to seeing more of that success in 2022.”

“Scott and the coaching staff played a key role in our success in 2021,” Dipoto said. “We’re very pleased to have Manny, Trent, Jarret, Perry, Carson and Pete return and equally excited that we were able to promote Tony, Andy and Kris from within our Player Development group. I believe this is a well-balanced staff that is focused on helping our players achieve to their full potential.”

Tony Arnerich (Hitting Coach) will be in his 1st season as the club’s Major League Hitting Coach. He spent the past two seasons (2020 & 2021) as the Mariners Minor League Field and Catching Coordinator. Arnerich joined the Mariners five years ago and spent his first three seasons (2017–2019) as the team’s Assistant Hitting Coordinator/Catching Coordinator. After retiring as a player in 2005, Arnerich spent nine seasons as a college coach, including from 2007 to 2014 as an assistant coach at Cal (Berkeley), where he helped lead the Golden Bears to a 2011 College World Series berth.

Jarret DeHart (Hitting Coach & Director of Hitting Strategy) will be in his 1st season as the club’s Hitting Coach after spending the 2020 and 2021 seasons as Asst. Hitting Coach. He was roving minor league hitting strategist for the Mariners in 2019. In that role, he often spent time with the Seattle big league hitters, as well as his work throughout Seattle’s minor league system. He spent the 2018 season as the hitting coach for the Arizona League Mariners. He played collegiately at LSU (2013–14) and Tulane University (2015–17).

Andy McKay (Major League Coach & Senior Director of Baseball Development) will be in his 1st season as the club’s Major League Coach & Sr. Director of Baseball Development. He joined the Mariners organization as Director of Player Development in Oct. 2015 and has helped establish the Mariners farm system as one of the best in the Major Leagues. McKay was Peak Performance Coordinator with the Colorado Rockies, beginning in Sept. 2012 until he joined the Mariners. Prior to his time with the Rockies, he was Head Baseball Coach at Sacramento City College for 14 seasons (1999–2012).

Kristopher Negrón (First Base Coach) will be in his 1st season as the club’s First Base Coach. He will also be responsible for outfield play and baserunning. The upcoming season will be his 3rd in the Mariners organization after serving as Manager for the Tacoma Rainiers in 2021 and Assistant to the Director of Player Development in 2020. Negrón was voted Triple-A West Manager of the Year after leading the Rainiers to a league championship with a 78–52 (.600) mark. Negrón appeared in parts of six Major League seasons as a player with Cincinnati (2012, 2014–15), Arizona (2017–18), Seattle (2018–19) and Los Angeles-NL (2019).

Manny Acta (Third Base Coach) returns for his 5th season as the club’s Third Base Coach, his 7th season overall on Seattle’s coaching staff. He spent two seasons (2018–2019) as the club’s Bench Coach. The 2021 season will be his 18th season as a Big League coach or manager. He managed the Cleveland Indians (2010–12) and Washington Nationals (2007–09) and, in addition to Seattle, has been a Major League third base coach with New York-NL (2005–06) and Montreal (2002–04).

Trent Blank (Bullpen Coach & Director of Pitching Strategy) returns for his 2nd season as the club’s Bullpen Coach. He spent the 2020 season as the club’s Acting Bullpen Coach before being promoted to Bullpen Coach prior to the 2021 season. The 2022 season will be his 3rd on a Big League coaching staff and his 4th as a coach in the Mariners organization. He joined the Mariners as the Coordinator of Pitching Strategy in 2019 and was tabbed to serve in that role again in 2020 before joining the Big League coaching staff. Prior to joining the Mariners organization, he spent 4 years with TMI Sports Medicine working as a Baseball Performance Specialist. Blank was originally selected by Colorado in the 30th round of the 2012 MLB First-Year Player Draft out of Baylor University. He appeared in 3 seasons (2012–14) in the Rockies minor league system.

Perry Hill (Infield Coach) returns for his 4th season with the Mariners and his 27th as a Big League coach in 2022. In 2021, Hill was responsible for Gold Glove finalist J.P. Crawford (shortstop), for the defensive emergence of Ty France, who was rated as FanGraph’s Best Defensive first baseman, and for assisting in successfully transitioning Abraham Toro to a fulltime role at second base. The Mariners were one of five Major League clubs with multiple Rawlings Gold Glove Award winners in 2020: Crawford and Evan White. Hill’s players have won a total of 10 Gold Glove Awards during his career.

Carson Vitale (Major League Field Coordinator) returns for his 3rd season as the club’s Major League Field Coordinator. He spent the 2018–19 seasons as the Mariners minor league field coordinator where he was responsible for all aspects of the on-field work done in the Player Development department by the Mariners players and staff. He joined the Mariners after spending two seasons (2016–17) as the Los Angeles Dodgers International Field Coordinator. He also spent four seasons (2012–15) in the player development department of the Los Angeles Angels. Carson was manager of the Dominican Summer League Angels in 2014–15. He is a graduate (2010) of Creighton University, and was a 38th round selection by the Texas Rangers in the 2010 First Year Player Draft.

Pete Woodworth (Pitching Coach) will be in his 3rd season as the club’s Pitching Coach. He spent the 2019 season as the pitching coach for the Arkansas Travelers, the Mariners affiliate in the AA Texas League. Following the 2019 season, Woodworth was named the Texas League Coach of the Year. The 2022 season will be his 7th in the Mariners organization. He spent 2017 and 2018 as the pitching coach for High-A Modesto after joining the Mariners on June 22, 2016 as the pitching coach at Class-A Clinton. He came to the Seattle organization from his alma mater, Florida Gulf Coast University.

In addition, Nasusel Cabrera will remain with the big league staff in his position as batting practice pitcher and Fleming Báez will return as bullpen catcher.
